page.title: 07H.GREEN & HAZLEMERE HISTORY
page.content: Holmer Green comes from the word "holmere" which means a "mere" in a hollow,(pond).Some street names tell us about local history,e.g. trades.The Saw-pit,used by the chairmaking industry, is now Saw-pit Hill.The wood for chairmaking came from Beech Tree Road.Sir Cecil Clementi, the Governor of Hong Kong and Malaya, lived in Holmer Court, Clementi Avenue was named after him.The famous artist Rossetti and his poet sister Christina stayed in Polidoris Lane with their grandparents,hence,Rossetti Place. Windmill Lane, where the windmill stood,is where the villagers used to grind their grain.Orchard End,Orchard Park,Orchard Way and Cherry Grove are named after the fruit growing tradition of the village.Hazlemere means Hazle fringed pool.The first document mentioning this was in the 13th century
